title: Paneer Paratha ðŸ˜€ || Paneer Stuffed Paratha Breakfast / Dinner || Indian Flat Bread
content:
Paneer Paratha: Breakfast Recipe: North India ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ Servings: 5 Paratha Duration: 20 mins Paratha is a flatbread originated from North India ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ it is a special breakfast for Indians such as Punjabiâ€™s in Punjab and also in Gujarat simply I can say itâ€™s completely North Indian dish. Now a days itâ€™s popular all over India and also serving in Indian restaurants and easy to prepare at home with ample time. There are many types of Parathaâ€™s which can be prepared with Wheat flour/ Atta/ Maida/ all purpose flour and veggies for stuffing. It can be also prepared with leafy vegetables such as Fenugreek leaves, spinach etc., and also combination of palak paneer, aloo paneer Paratha, Aloo Methi paratha like this wise you can make so many varieties of parathaâ€™s. Mostly it is prepared at breakfast time, you should have parathaâ€™s when they are hot because it tastes delicious ðŸ˜‹ Mainly, itâ€™s cooked with ghee/ butter/ cooking oil and serve with Raita/ curd and any kind of pickle (Indian pickles) Ingredients: Chapathi/ Roti Dough :
  • Wheat Flour - 320 gms
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
Below link explained how to make Chapathi/ Roti Dough Chapathi/ Roti Stuffing/ Paneer Mixture:
  • Grated Paneer - 200 gms
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tb sp
  • Coriander Powder - 1 tb sp
  • Dry Mango powder - 1/2 tb sp
  • Cumin seeds - 1/2 tb sp
  • Ajwain/ Vamu - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Lemon juice - 2 tb sp
  • Cilantro / Coriander - finely chopped - 3 tb sp
  • Green chillies - finely chopped - 2
To Cook Paratha: Butter - 2 tb sp - melted Procedure: Process of paneer stuffing:
  • Take a big bowl
  • Add grated paneer, cumin seeds, Ajwain seeds, red chilly powder, coriander powder, dry Mango powder, coriander, lemon juice, salt and green chillies
  • Mix well
  • Keep it aside
Making Stuffed Paratha/ Paneer Paratha :
  • Get set with Chapathi dough and paneer mixture for stuffing
  • Divide dough anand make equal balls like orange size
  • Take a dough ball and flour for dusting
  • Roll it 5 inch by using rolling pin
  • Mean while, heat tava over medium heat
  • Take & Place 3 tb sp paneer mixture on rolled dough
  • Close it with a twist as shown in picture
  • Close it completely so that stuffing won't comes out
  • Now dust some flour on it and press with hand, so that paneer mixture spreads equally
  • Now, roll it thin / thick Paratha
  • Tava is hot, place rolled Paratha on it
  • Flip after 30 secs
  • Apply butter
  • Let it cook for 30 secs
  • Flip the other side & apply butter
  • Cook both sides equally till brown dots appear
  • Serve hot with curd/ yogurt or pickle ( Indian pickle)
  • It's best to have with a slice of onion & Cucumber
  • Happy cooking, enjoy your day ðŸ™‚
Step by step process shown below with pictures: [caption id="attachment_7556" align="alignnone" width="1020"] Paneer Paratha ðŸ˜‹[/caption] Note:
  • Paneer stuffed Paratha are so soft best to have them when they are hot
  • To cook Paratha, Instead of butter you can also use ghee
  • Adjust spices according to taste
